column3: Latest;A------ wildlife conservation organization in Cambodia has told Rasmei Kampuchea that a group of foreign veterinarians has arrived in Cambodia’s Mondulkiri province
column4: bringing  medical equipment and supplies for the treatment of elephant diseases.------Khun Dion
column5: director of Cambodia’s elephant conservation organization in Mondolkiri
column6: reported that through the results of the teacher’s examination medical experts have suggested that nearly 40 elephants have some medical problems.------In addition
column7: some  elephants have the TB disease requiring a 15-day inspection. These elephants have been diagnosed by doctors. ------Dr. Dion praised physicians from Australia and the United States
column8: who volunteered to check the elephants for two weeks.------The vets also distributed syringes and drugs for treating TB and other problems.
